B. KEMAL PASHA, J.
ORDER
Petitioners are accused in C.C. No.1736 of 2015 of the
Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha, which
has arisen from Crime No.543 of 2015 of the Alappuzha
North Police Station, Alappuzha, registered for the offences
punishable under Sections 323, 324 and 341 of the Indian
Penal Code read with Section 34 IPC.

2. The matter has been amicably settled between
the petitioners and the defacto complainant, who is the 2"
respondent herein. The defacto complainant has filed

asi
2016/KER/66
CRL.M.C.No. 7858 of 2015 uoe
Annexure-lll affidavit affirming that the matter has been
amicably settled between him and the petitioners and he
has no complaints against the petitioners.

3. There is a connected case also in the matter
registered as Crime No.430 of 2015 of the same Police
Station. The matter involved in the said crime has also been
settled between the parties. No criminal antecedents have
been reported against the petitioners. When the matter has
been amicably settled, no purpose would be served in
proceeding with the matter further, and therefore, all further
proceedings in C.C. No.1736 of 2015 pending before the
Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha, as
against the petitioners, based on Annexure-Il Final Report in
Crime No.543 of 2015 of the Alappuzha North Police
Station, Alappuzha, can be quashed.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further
proceedings in C.C. No.1736 of 2015 pending before the
Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha, as

ee
a
2016/KER/66
CRL.M.C.No. 7858 of 2015
-3:-
against the petitioners, based on Annexure-Il Final Report in
Crime No.543 of 2015 of the Alappuzha North Police
Station, Alappuzha, are hereby quashed.
Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA,
JUDGE.
